useConsistentTypeDefinitions.description:
Description

Enforce type definitions to consistently use eitherinterfaceortype.
TypeScriptprovides two different ways to define an object type:interfaceandtype.
This rule enforces consistent usage of eitherinterfaceortypefor object type definitions.
Consistent type definition styles, aside from improving code readability, help minimize cognitive load when developers
switch between different codebases or within a large codebase.
Empty object type declarations will be left as-is and will not be converted to interfaces,
as it will conflict with thenoEmptyInterfacerule.
